pages.content:
[HEADING] About the MSE CS Program
[HEADING] Learn about the admissions process and apply today
[HEADING] For Current Students
[HEADING] Site Menu
The Computer Science Department Johns Hopkins University’s Whiting School of Engineering offers full-time programs at the Homewood campus in Baltimore. Our MSE program unites the creativity and innovation needed to realize the future’s limitless possibilities. Dedicated to solving critical societal challenges through advances in computing technology, our research targets core topics in computing in a broad range of applications, including robotics, human language technology, social policy, and disease diagnosis and treatment.
Working with partners across the Johns Hopkins institutions—including clinicians in the School of Medicine, scientists in the Krieger School of Arts and Sciences, and engineers at the Applied Physics Laboratory—we’re pursuing the potential and promise of data science and AI in an environment where the values of humanity, ethics, and accessibility are integral—where innovation is informed by the diverse voices and perspectives that reflect the world we serve.
The MSE in Computer Science offers an official concentration offers an official concentration in Human Language Technology, its only concentration jointly administered with the Center for Language and Speech Processing. Students may also choose to pursue an unofficial track more broadly in Artificial Intelligence.
As part of the Home to Hopkins program, full-time students are eligible to take up to two online courses through the Whiting School’s Engineering for Professionals program the summer before they start their full-time, residential master’s program. These courses apply to their master’s degree if satisfactorily completed. You can view the list of approved courses here. Email admissions@cs.jhu.edu to request more information.
Learn about admissions and requirements for the MSE (Master’s of Science in Engineering) CS program at the Johns Hopkins University.
Policies, resources, forms, course information, and services for graduate students.
• MSE CS Admissions
• Program Requirements
• MSE FAQ

Our MSE program unites the creativity and innovation needed to realize the future’s limitless possibilities. Dedicated to solving critical societal challenges through advances in computing technology, our research targets core topics in computing in a broad range of applications, including robotics, human language technology, social policy, and disease diagnosis and treatment.
Working with partners across the Johns Hopkins institutions—including clinicians in the School of Medicine, scientists in the Krieger School of Arts and Sciences, and engineers at the Applied Physics Laboratory—we’re pursuing the potential and promise of data science and AI in an environment where the values of humanity, ethics, and accessibility are integral—where innovation is informed by the diverse voices and perspectives that reflect the world we serve.
The MSE in Computer Science offers an official concentration offers an official concentration in Human Language Technology, its only concentration jointly administered with the Center for Language and Speech Processing. Students may also choose to pursue an unofficial track more broadly in Artificial Intelligence.
As part of the Home to Hopkins program, full-time students are eligible to take up to two online courses through the Whiting School’s Engineering for Professionals program the summer before they start their full-time, residential master’s program. These courses apply to their master’s degree if satisfactorily completed. You can view the list of approved courses here. Email admissions@cs.jhu.edu to request more information.

pages.content:
[HEADING] Application Resources
[HEADING] Admissions Information
[HEADING] Standardized Test Information
[HEADING] Application Deadlines
[HEADING] Contact Information
[HEADING] Site Menu
The MSE CS program is open to exceptional candidates who have completed a program of study equivalent to that required by the BS in computer science. Applicants from other disciplines are expected to have coursework (or equivalent experience) in intermediate programming (C++ and Java), data structures, computer system fundamentals, and mathematical foundations for computer science. This can be demonstrated through coursework, research and working experiences.
Apply free! No application fees required.
The Department of Computer Science reviews applications on a holistic basis and does NOT require a GRE score.
As general reference ONLY, the preferred scores are as follows:
We encourage all prospective students to apply as early as possible. To ensure full consideration, all application materials must be received by the deadline listed below. Review of applications received after the deadline is not guaranteed.
For questions regarding your graduate application, please contact the Johns Hopkins University Graduate Admissions Office.

• Combined/Concurrent Degree Application Process

2 letters of recommendation
TOEFL/IELTS (for international applicants only)

The MSE CS program is open to exceptional candidates who have completed a program of study equivalent to that required by the BS in computer science. Applicants from other disciplines are expected to have coursework (or equivalent experience) in intermediate programming (C++ and Java), data structures, computer system fundamentals, and mathematical foundations for computer science. This can be demonstrated through coursework, research and working experiences.

pages.title: Admissions - Department of Computer Science

pages.content:
[HEADING] Site Menu
Completion of the MSE CS program requires 8 approved courses of 3 or more credit hours or the equivalent and a faculty–guided research project OR 10 approved courses. Students have the option to add the only CS master’s concentration in Human Language and Technology or to pursue an unofficial track more broadly in Artificial Intelligence.
• Course Requirement I: 8 one-semester courses in Computer Science (or in closely related fields such as Electrical and Computer Engineering, Cognitive Science, Mathematics, or Mathematical Sciences) approved by faculty advisor. A minimum of four courses must be from the following core areas: Application, Reasoning, Software, Systems, Theory.
• Course Requirement II: Two Computer Science graduate courses or a research project including a report, essay, or thesis.
[GRID_TABLE]
Completion of the MSE CS program requires 8 approved courses of 3 or more credit hours or the equivalent and a faculty–guided research project OR 10 approved courses. Students have the option to add the only CS master’s concentration in Human Language and Technology or to pursue an unofficial track more broadly in Artificial Intelligence.

Course Requirement I: 8 one-semester courses in Computer Science (or in closely related fields such as Electrical and Computer Engineering, Cognitive Science, Mathematics, or Mathematical Sciences) approved by faculty advisor. A minimum of four courses must be from the following core areas: Application, Reasoning, Software, Systems, Theory.
Course Requirement II: Two Computer Science graduate courses or a research project including a report, essay, or thesis.
Site Menu
Close
﻿
